intro: Rathbunia queretaroensis, commonly known as the Mexican false heather, is a flowering plant native to central Mexico. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, elliptical leaves and produces fruits that are capsules containing numerous tiny seeds. Rathbunia queretaroensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its native habitat.
